column9: It took a few days before I received relief.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had very strong painful urges to urinate resembling a UTI but no infection was found.  I am currently scheduled to be tested for IC.  Urologist placed me on Prosed and I found immediate relief from the frequent painful urges.  I now can wait generally at least an hour and sometimes up to two hours before urinating.  Prior to this I was having to go every 10-15 minutes.

column2: MaggieDee, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been diagnosed with Interstitial Cystitis.  Treatment from my Dr/clinical nurse requires catherization of the already tender bladder.  The Prosed relieves the tenderness and resulting pain from these treatments.  My life is really turning around after many months of discomfort before diagnosis.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This took care of the burning and bladder spasms that came with a very severe UTI.Within about 4 hours of the 1st dose I was feeling better.  However, I too have had a severe reaction with the redness and severe itching, mainly in my lower legs and back. I would still take this, the itching is way better than the pain I was in with the UTI!

column9: this medicine works for spasms of the bladder and discomfort it is hard to describe it is at the bottom of the bladder after a examination it  disturbs the bladder and it is so uncomfortable. after i had the sling removed it has been a horrible experience with burning and irretable symthoms

column9: I have been taking app. 4 months and now I have noticed that I have some slight incontinence  not stress related.  Is this a typical or common side effect?  I was rx'd this med due to dysuria.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Used for retentive bladder as anticeptic. Can it cause hair(head) loss?

column2: kg, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I too had all the classic symptoms of a UTI, but no infection ever showed up on my urine samples-I had several.  Finally went to see a Uro-Gynocologist who seems to have correctly diagnosed me with Interstitial Cystitis.  She immediately put me on Prosed to help relieve my symptoms and it has worked!  I had gone to 2 other Urologists & they dismissed IC, and gave me Vesicare to treat my symptoms, but didn't get to the cause.  Prosed is a start to proper treatment for me!

column2: Mia, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I also have been having constant UTI like symptoms with no answers for over 6 weeks now. All cultures come back negative & bladder looks fine.

column2: rbpjsa, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this for one month now. Took away my condition of VERY painful urination. Condition was most likely an after effect of prostate cancer treatmnt recieved in 11/06.

column2: Mom-mom re, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Using this drug to try to lessen almost constant UTI's which after numerous test no reason can be found. Jury still out on effectiveness, this is my second month on it,I have noticed joint pain as mentioned by someone else, has anyone else noticed this?Anyone getting UTI's this frequently?

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been using Prosed/DS for four days.  It has taken care of all my symptoms except that the urinary muscles still feel like they are always "on", but there is no pain.  I have used pyridium in the past (15 years) and think this is a far superior drug.  The only drawback has been that my more acidic urine is making my skin vey sensitive/itchy.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: constant bladder pain has disappeared...

column2: ellesse, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication as needed for more than a year.  It is a good rescue drug for those of us who suffer from interstitial cystitis.  However, it causes permanent staining of the toilet bowl.  Truly impossible to remove.

column2: Julie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am taking this drug for IC. Has anyone else noticed severe muscle and joint pain associated with taking Prosed?

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used this drug when first diagnosed with interstitial cystitis, and the improvement from pain was very good. Yes, it does have all those staining issues others have mentioned. One side effect is possible urinary retention, and it was for this reason that I stopped, and changed to pyridium, which is not as effective for pain. But for the IC sufferer it can be a very good "rescue" drug if you have a flare,and for this reason I continue to keep it on hand.

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This medication urine is blue - always. It does stain - I think the doctor prescribed pills too quickly.  I would not take it unless you are sure you HAVE to

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At present I am experiencing significant redness of the skin after begining a 1-2 a daly oral treatment 25 days ago. Under treatment with a topical steriod and ceased medication.Also,medication significantly stains toilet surfaces a blue that is difficult to remove -- to say nothing of what my insides must look like!

column2: Jea, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Warning - this prooduct contains apirin like chemicals and you need to make sure to ask your doctor before taking it, if you are on Plavix, 81mg ASA per day, or any other "blood thinner".
